subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Alphabetical Order
msgSnippet: ... I didn t want to bring this up earlier, but now seems the place for it. We could also get rid of either Wool or Ooze. As Wells points out, only 40 words
messageBody:
Anthony Grahn wrote:

> >
>
> I also notice that few other spelling reform programs have 3 letters
> for the Ah, Awe, Ox groups. Unifon does not and, most interestingly,
> the venerable "New Spelling" which John Wells contributes to, does not.
>
> A slight simplification of Ah / Awe / Ox has some real advantages:
>

I didn't want to bring this up earlier, but now seems the place for it.
We could also get rid of either Wool or Ooze. As Wells points out, only
40 words use Wool as their vowel. I don't think there would be any
confusion created by getting rid of one letter and spelling all words
with the other. Though I clearly distinguish between the two and would
find it funny to hear "food" pronouced to rhyme with "good," I find I
have to think when choosing the vowel for words like "put."

On the other hand, since Wool and Ooze cause no confusion (unlike On
Awl, and Ah), we could just as well keep both Wool and Ooze.

Paul
